caption:
The photograph depicts a logging scene with a strong outdoor, labor-intensive theme. A shirtless man, possibly a logger, is in the midst of physical labor. He is bent over while standing on a stack of substantial logs that have dark, rugged surfaces and are bound together with ropes. The logs display a rough texture, hinting at their recent removal from their natural environment. The background is composed of a barren, muddy terrain with additional logs and debris scattered around, emphasizing a cleared or deforested area.

The setting appears overcast with low light, which adds a somber, hardworking tone to the image. There's a sense of solitude in the atmosphere surrounding the man and his task, highlighting the tough conditions typically associated with such labor-intensive industries. The emphasis on natural materials and the evident physical effort speak to themes of nature, human activity, and the environmental impact of logging.
title: In August, 1973 a major forest fire swept through 17,470 acres of the western slopes of the Sierra mountain range near Sonora. A "cat skinner" works in post-fire salvage operations. Caterpillar tractors are used to haul logs to "landing area" (seen here), where they are loaded onto trucks.
